content: Hi ,

Hi, I want to setup development environment for , but the link that should guide me is not active.https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/master/README.dev.md#brief-installation-instructions-for-vagrant-development-environment
Try http://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/brief-install-vagrant-dev.html
Thanks!
We just did a lot of refactoring our docs, sorry about the broken link!

@Aswin kumar where did you find a link to that page? I had thought we'd removed all references to the (now removed) README.dev.md, but if we missed somewhere, it'd be good to know where so we can update it...
I had found it here https://www.google.com/url?q=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fzulip%2Fzulip-android%23getting-started&sa=D&sntz=1&usg=AFQjCNGqS-zoAuvoAzpWtx3snwa2-xwx_w
In the getting started section
ahh, totally makes sense, hadn't thought about the Android repo docs. I'll go ahead and fix that. Thanks @Aswin kumar!

I am unable to start the zulip server, typed in the below command

(zulip-venv)vagrant@vagrant-ubuntu-trusty-64:~ $
/srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py --interface=''

(zulip-venv)vagrant@vagrant-base-trusty-amd64:~$ /srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py --interface=''
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py", line 114, in <module>
reactor.listenTCP(proxy_port, server.Site(Resource()), interface=options.interface)
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/4b454997148e863f32d4602d049cea7ef49623f4/zulip-venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/twisted/internet/posixbase.py", line 492, in listenTCP
p.startListening()
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/4b454997148e863f32d4602d049cea7ef49623f4/zulip-venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/twisted/internet/tcp.py", line 984, in startListening
raise CannotListenError(self.interface, self.port, le)
CannotListenError: Couldn't listen on any:9991: [Errno 98] Address already in use.
Terminated
Cannot start the zulip server

(zulip-venv)vagrant@vagrant-base-trusty-amd64:~$ /srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py --interface=''
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/srv/zulip/tools/run-dev.py", line 114, in <module>
reactor.listenTCP(proxy_port, server.Site(Resource()), interface=options.interface)
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/4b454997148e863f32d4602d049cea7ef49623f4/zulip-venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/twisted/internet/posixbase.py", line 492, in listenTCP
p.startListening()
File "/srv/zulip-venv-cache/4b454997148e863f32d4602d049cea7ef49623f4/zulip-venv/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/twisted/internet/tcp.py", line 984, in startListening
raise CannotListenError(self.interface, self.port, le)
CannotListenError: Couldn't listen on any:9991: [Errno 98] Address already in use.
Terminated
so, that error almost certainly means part of the server is already running. Try running pkill -f python to kill existing Zulip server processes
I tried pkill , got the same error
sometimes the OS won't release the port even after the process is killed (it's a long story related to TCP mechanics)
You can probably hack line 68 of run_dev.py to listen on a different port
try ps -ef | grep python to confirm things are killed?

(The OS will eventually release the port, but I am trying to get you unblocked for now. Pick a port that is not between 9991 and 9994, because base_port is just the webserver, and then there are three other ports we use for django/tornado/webpack.) But, yeah, also what Tim said, you might need kill -9.
If you change the port, you may have problems with the fact that Vagrant only forwards port 9991
ugh I didn't know that
(configurable by ~/.zulip-vagrant-config)
ports 9992 and 9993 are in use , I am going to free them and try to start the server again
Got it Thanks!, The server is running now!
Awesome! Thanks for you patience!
Great! @Aswin kumar are you enjoying Zulip? How has your experience gone?

@Sumana Harihareswara Its been good , till now.I will have to set up my own Zulip server and test it. I am new to python and learning the basics of web development. I used to use IRC for communication with other developers.I found that file sharing was not possible and there were no streams like Zulip has, so thought of building my own application similar to IRC with only some better features until I came across Zulip. Any guidance is welcome regarding web development in python. Thanks!

@Aswin kumar I got a lot out of working through the Django documentation https://docs.djangoproject.com/ . I also came up with a small project (a sort of silly form that took in a few words and then generated a small fake speech) and implemented it in a few different frameworks, which is how I learned, for instance, Flask.
@Aswin kumar Glad you are finding Zulip interesting! Please let us know if you run into any more trouble as you're working on setup and testing.
